You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 216, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 696, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 84, 670, 301]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 320, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
Coplanar forces of magnitudes \(20 \text{N}, P \text{N}, 3P \text{N}\) and \(4P \text{N}\) act at a point in the directions shown in the diagram. The system is in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 368, 230, 386]]<|/det|>
Find \(P\) and \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 368, 920, 386]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 85, 705, 225]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 242, 920, 293]]<|/det|>
A particle of mass \(2.5 \mathrm{~kg}\) is held in equilibrium on a rough plane inclined at \(20^{\circ}\) to the horizontal by a force of magnitude \(T \mathrm{~N}\) making an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) with a line of greatest slope of the plane (see diagram). The coefficient of friction between the particle and the plane is 0.3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 305, 500, 324]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest and least possible values of \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 531, 92]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1250\mathrm{kg}\) is moving on a straight road.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 106, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
On a horizontal section of the road, the car has a constant speed of \(32 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) and there is a constant force of \(750 \mathrm{N}\) resisting the motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 146, 196, 164]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[198, 145, 702, 164]]<|/det|>
Calculate, in kW, the power developed by the engine of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
On a section of the road inclined at \(\sin^{-1} 0.096\) to the horizontal, the resistance to the motion of the car is \((1000 + 8v) \text{N}\) when the speed of the car is \(v \text{m s}^{-1}\). The car travels up this section of the road at constant speed with the engine working at \(60 \text{kW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 358, 154]]<|/det|>
Find this constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 751, 94]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line. The velocity \(\nu \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) at time \(t \mathrm{s}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 98, 603, 118]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = 2t + 1\qquad \mathrm{for} 0\leqslant t\leqslant 5,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 117, 603, 138]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = 36 - t^{2}\qquad \mathrm{for} 5\leqslant t\leqslant 7,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 137, 628, 157]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = 2t - 27\qquad \mathrm{for} 7\leqslant t\leqslant 13.5.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 175, 146, 193]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 175, 537, 193]]<|/det|>
Sketch the velocity-time graph for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant 13.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 193]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 588, 148, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 588, 529, 606]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration at the instant when \(t = 6\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 588, 920, 606]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 673, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the total distance travelled by \(P\) in the interval \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant 13.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
